item.title: Turn Dependabot Off
item.description: I recommend turning Dependabot off and replacing it with a pair of scheduled GitHub Actions, one running govulncheck, and the other running CI against the latest version of your dependencies.

item.title: I found a Vulnerability. They found a Lawyer.
item.description: What happens when you responsibly disclose a critical vulnerability exposing personal data - including that of minors - and the organization responds with legal threats instead of a thank you?

item.title: Django ORM Standalone⁽¹⁾: Querying an existing database
item.description: A practical step-by-step guide to using Django ORM in standalone mode to connect to and query an existing database using inspectdb.

item.title: Inside PostgreSQL's 8KB Page
item.description: A byte-level tour of the 8KB page. PostgreSQL's atomic unit of storage. We deep dive into page headers, line pointers, and free space using pageinspect to see exactly how your data lives on disk.

item.title: How will OpenAI compete? — Benedict Evans
item.description: OpenAI has some big questions. It doesn’t have unique tech. It has a big user base, but with limited engagement and stickiness and no network effect. The incumbents have matched the tech and are leveraging their product and distribution. And a lot of the value and leverage will come from new experie

My Coding Agent Watches Me Get Frustrated, Then Fixes Itself
item.description: pi-reflect reads your coding agent's session logs, finds where you got frustrated, and edits its rules so the same mistakes don't happen again.

item.title: satisfies never off by one
item.description: Exhaustiveness checking in TypeScript. Works with `if` and ternary expressions. No unnecessary conditions or unreachable code.

item.title: PGQueuer for High-Performance Job Queues
item.description: PGQueuer takes a PostgreSQL database and can turn it into a reliable background job processor. The problem becomes how on the face unwieldy the technology is. Because it’s powerful, it requires a lot to get into, especially for people new to backend development.

item.description: Three AI-built products, three critical security vulnerabilities. An afternoon of casual testing reveals what happens when nobody understands the code that runs their product.

item.title: Vibe Coding vs Vibe Engineering
item.description: Coding is only one aspect of the engineering process. We don't have to leverage LLMs just to code. We can leverage them to engineer better software.

item.title: Teleoperation is Always the Butt of the Joke

item.description: By Ljubisa Bajic Many believe AI is the real deal. In narrow domains, it already surpasses human performance. item.title: Reaction-Diffusion: Gray-Scott on a 2D Grid
item.description: A detailed breakdown of the Gray-Scott reaction-diffusion algorithm. Includes an interactive canvas demo and explains the PDE model, Laplacian stencil, double buffering, and boundary handling.

item.title: Async Await Just Got A Massive Improvement in .NET
item.description:
Learn Hands-On for Free at Dometrain: https://dometrain.com/courses/?ref=nick-chapsas&promo=youtube
Hello, everybody. I'm Nick, and in this video, I will talk about the new .NET 11 Runtime Async feature. It completely changes the game in performance for Async Await code and I want to talk about its benefits.
